body: I can confirm this issue running 32248471667dbdea33fca5e12fa0cb8a43482106 on Arch Linux. Setting font size to `11.0` prevents crashing. `10.0` crashes reproducibly. Changing the font used does not have any effect.

Thanks @Somelauw for all the debugging.

I'm uncertain what to do at this point. Consider the log line:
```
pitch=1; pitch_raw=1, rows=3; width=3; char="
```
FreeType is telling us that the glyph data occupies 3 rows each with 3 bytes of glyph data (total 9 bytes). However, the pitch says that the buffer is only 1 byte per row (total 3 bytes). Naturally when we attempt to read all 9 bytes, we encounter an issue.

According to the FreeType docs, pitch should *always* be greater than or equal to width, but that's not what we see in this case.

I was considering inspecting the `freetype-rs` wrapper we are using to make sure it's not accidentally introducing an error.

Oh, I just realized we are a few versions behind on `freetype-rs`. Maybe one of you experiencing this error could run `cargo update -p freetype-rs`, rebuild, and see if the bug still occurs?

[FreeType docs]: https://www.freetype.org/freetype2/docs/glyphs/glyphs-7.html
